executable.title: Robust Statistics Segmenter
executable.description: Active contour segmentation using robust statistic.
executable.contributor: Yi Gao (gatech), Allen Tannenbaum (gatech), Ron Kikinis (SPL, BWH)
executable.acknowledgements: This work is part of the National Alliance for Medical Image Computing (NAMIC), funded by the National Institutes of Health

double.name: expectedVolume
double.description: The approximate volume of the object, in mL.
double.label: Approximate volume(mL)

parameters.label: Auxiliary Parameters
parameters.description: Some auxiliary parameters to control the stop criteria.

double.name: intensityHomogeneity
double.description: What is the homogeneity of intensity within the object? Given constant intensity at 1.0 score and extreme fluctuating intensity at 0.
double.label: Intensity Homogeneity[0-1.0]

double.name: curvatureWeight
double.description: Given sphere 1.0 score and extreme rough bounday/surface 0 score, what is the expected smoothness of the object?
double.label: Boundary Smoothness[0-1.0]

integer.name: labelValue
integer.description: Label value of the output image
integer.label: Output Label Value

double.name: maxRunningTime
double.description: The program will stop if this time is reached.
double.label: Max running time(min)
